meanings.definition: The state or condition of being collected or gathered together as a group.
meanings.sent1: The collectivity of students in the classroom was evident during group activities.
meanings.sent2: The collectivity of ants working together to build their nest is fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The collectivity of birds chirping in unison created a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent4: The collectivity of stars in the night sky seemed to form a celestial pattern.
meanings.sent5: The collectivity of colors in the painting made it truly captivating.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals or things that are considered as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The collectivity of employees at the company picnic was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The collectivity of books on the shelf made the library a treasure trove of knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The collectivity of vegetables in the garden seemed to have a secret meeting.
meanings.sent4: The collectivity of waves crashing against the shore was a powerful sight.
meanings.sent5: The collectivity of voices in the choir resonated throughout the hall.
